audio_segments.text: Once upon a time, in a peaceful forest, there lived a young boy named Shriyan who loved to play with the forest animals.
[softly] One day, Shriyan found a basket of delicious berries near the rabbit's burrow. He ate them all, even though they weren't his.
When Ruby the Rabbit asked, 'Shriyan, did you see my berries?' Shriyan felt nervous and said, 'No, I didn't see them.'
[sadly] Ruby looked so sad and disappointed. She had been saving those berries for her family's dinner.
Shriyan felt terrible inside. His tummy hurt, not from the berries, but from the lie he had told his friend.
[thoughtfully] That night, Shriyan couldn't sleep. He knew what he had to do.
The next morning, Shriyan went to Ruby and said, 'I'm sorry, Ruby. I ate your berries and I lied about it. I was wrong.'
[warmly] Ruby smiled gently. 'Thank you for telling the truth, Shriyan. That took courage. I forgive you.'
[excitedly] Shriyan and Ruby worked together to find more berries, and they had even more fun gathering them as a team!
[softly] From that day on, Shriyan always told the truth, because he learned that honesty makes friendships stronger and hearts feel lighter.
And the forest animals all knew they could trust Shriyan, their honest and brave friend.

story.content: Once upon a time, in a peaceful forest, there lived a young boy named Shriyan who loved to play with the forest animals. [softly] One day, Shriyan found a basket of delicious berries near the rabbit's burrow. He ate them all, even though they weren't his. When Ruby the Rabbit asked, 'Shriyan, did you see my berries?' Shriyan felt nervous and said, 'No, I didn't see them.' [sadly] Ruby looked so sad and disappointed. She had been saving those berries for her family's dinner. Shriyan felt terrible inside. His tummy hurt, not from the berries, but from the lie he had told his friend. [thoughtfully] That night, Shriyan couldn't sleep. He knew what he had to do. The next morning, Shriyan went to Ruby and said, 'I'm sorry, Ruby. I ate your berries and I lied about it. I was wrong.' [warmly] Ruby smiled gently. 'Thank you for telling the truth, Shriyan. That took courage. I forgive you.' [excitedly] Shriyan and Ruby worked together to find more berries, and they had even more fun gathering them as a team! [softly] From that day on, Shriyan always told the truth, because he learned that honesty makes friendships stronger and hearts feel lighter. And the forest animals all knew they could trust Shriyan, their honest and brave friend. [whispers] And the stars whispered, goodnight.

story.title: Shriyan and the Honest Rabbit
